news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Hippo Harvest, an indoor farming startup, raised $21M in Series B funding, utilizing repurposed warehouse robots for produce growth, specifically for Amazon Fresh. The funding will support the company's controlled environment agriculture technology, enhancing sustainable agriculture practices.

overview_description.description:
Hippo Harvest develops an agriculture technology to help scale sustainable agriculture.

It was founded in 2019 and is based in Half Moon Bay, California.

about_short_description.short_description: Hippo Harvest develops an agriculture technology to help scale sustainable agriculture.

product.name: Sustainable Lettuce
product.description: Indoor-grown lettuce that is fresher, safer, and more sustainable, produced in climate-controlled environments to ensure year-round availability.

product.name: Indoor Greenhouse Farming
product.description: Controlled greenhouse farming that reduces the risk of recalls and ensures fresh food availability regardless of weather conditions.

product.name: Custom Nutrient Delivery
product.description: A system that delivers tailored doses of nutrients directly to plant roots at each life stage, reducing fertilizer use.

product.name: Water Management System
product.description: A water delivery system that provides plants with the exact amount of water they need, reducing water usage.

product.name: Local Production
product.description: Growing produce in local greenhouses to reduce food miles and ensure fresher produce with a longer shelf life.

product.name: Pesticide-Free Farming
product.description: A farming method that avoids synthetic pesticides, reducing risks to wildlife, water supplies, and human health.
